en: They rescued him from danger.

ko: 걔네가 실수로 내 가방을 런던으로 보냈어.

en: It seems that they took the wrong train.
ko: 걔네 기차를 잘못 탄 것 같아.

en: They blamed themselves for being wrong.
They set out on a sightseeing tour.
They are satisfied with a simple life.
They acclaimed her Queen.
They acclaimed him as their leader.
They experienced emotional pain and despair.
They gave themselves up to the enjoyment of sensual pleasures.
Learning runs in their blood.
They set up a school.
They live near the school.
They didn't have to speak about our school.
ko: 걔네가 우리 학교에 대해 말할 필요는 없었어.

en: They are getting on the bus at the corner.
ko: 걔네 길 모퉁이에서 버스 타고 있어.

en: They failed to get any definite information.
ko: 걔네 확실한 정보를 하나도 못 얻었어.

en: They seem to be worrying about nuclear weapons.
ko: 걔네 핵무기 때문에 걱정하는 것 같아.

en: They are afraid that nuclear war will break out.
They allotted to each player the benefits due him.
ko: 걔네가 선수들 각자한테 돌아갈 혜택을 나눠줬어.

en: They cleared the street of snow.
They cannot have gone out, because the light is on.
ko: 불 켜져 있는 거 보니까 걔네 나갔을 리 없어.

en: They easily adapted to living abroad.
They all respect him.
They all laughed at his jokes.
ko: 걔네 다 그 사람 농담에 웃었어.

en: They are people of a kind.
All of them have independent means.
They are all dead.
They were all great men.
They all boosted the candidate.
They all went to the restaurant.
They all got into the taxi at once.
They all account Mr James an able businessman.
ko: 걔네 다 제임스 씨를 유능한 사업가로 생각해.

en: They are all good men at heart.
They all appeared satisfied with your answers.
ko: 다들 네 답변에 만족하는 것 같더라.

en: They are all in a hurry to catch a train.
They all termed it nonsense.
ko: 다들 말도 안 되는 소리라고 했어.

en: They laid down a scheme for extracting salt from seawater.
ko: 걔네 바닷물에서 소금 뽑아내는 계획을 세웠어.

en: They strolled along the beach.
They made for the seashore.
They spent the night on the beach.
They bought a site with lovely views of the ocean.
They seem determined to press forward with their program of reform.
ko: 걔네 개혁안을 계속 밀고 나갈 생각인가 봐.

en: They carried the injured man by car to the hospital.
They were transferred from one office to another.
ko: 이 사무실 저 사무실로 발령 났어.

en: They blamed him for the failure of the company.
ko: 걔네 회사가 망한 걸 그 사람 탓으로 돌렸어.

en: They arranged a meeting.
He kept silent during the meeting.
ko: 걔 회의하는 내내 입 꾹 다물고 있더라.

en: Every time they meet, they quarrel.
They can not meet without quarreling with each other.
They are on the border of starvation.
They are suffering from hunger.
They call us problem children.
They refused to help us.
They are more emotional than we.
They're more emotional than us.
They're more emotional than we are.
They scorned our attempts at reconciliation.
They are of us, you know.
They rejoiced over the news of our success.
ko: 걔네 우리 성공 소식 듣고 진짜 기뻐했어.

en: They came to our assistance.
They obstructed our plan.
They departed ten days in advance of our party.
ko: 걔네 우리 팀보다 열흘 먼저 출발했어.

en: They defeated our team by three goals.
ko: 걔네가 우리 팀을 세 골 차로 이겼어.

en: They enforced obedience upon us.
They appealed to us for help.
They warned us of our possible failure in this plan.
ko: 걔네가 이 계획이 실패할 수도 있다고 경고했어.

en: They deposited their bundles on the rock.
ko: 걔네 짐 보따리를 바위 위에 내려놨어.

en: They set off fireworks.
They blew up the bridge with gunpowder.
They clustered around the fire.
ko: 걔네 불 주변에 옹기종기 모여 있었어.

en: They complained of the cold as there was no fire there.
They moved farther away from the fire.
They enjoyed singing songs.
They went along the street singing the song.
They walked down the street singing a song.
They canned the fruits to preserve them.
They are fond of fruit.
They sell fruit, bread, cakes, and many other things.
ko: 거기 과일이랑 빵, 케이크랑 이것저것 많이 팔아.

en: They are spraying the fruit trees.
They chatted with each other to pass the time.
Because they had no time to spare, they hurried back to town.
ko: 시간이 없어서 걔네 서둘러서 마을로 돌아갔어.

en: They guard their families from poverty.
They saw the sights of Kyoto with their family.
They broke down the house.
They are saving their money for the purchase of a house.
They are building a house.
They set about building a house.
They have a good store of food in the house.
They are used to the humid climate of the summer.
They are in comfortable circumstance.
They had been living where they could, sharing flats and baths, and kitchens, for some years.
ko: 몇 년 동안 화장실이랑 주방도 같이 쓰면서 여기저기 전전하며 살았어.

en: They were thought to have died many years before.
They communicated with the Western countries.
They went on talking for hours.
They went on arguing for hours.
They waited for him for hours.
They stick to old customs in everything.
They lacked for nothing.
They had to read the book many times.
ko: 그 책을 여러 번 읽어야 했어.

en: What are they at?
What are they after?
What are they doing?
They want, above all things to live in peace.
They want, more than anything else, to live in peace.
ko: 그 무엇보다 평화롭게 살고 싶어 해.

en: They walked miles and miles.
They weren't able to discover any secrets.
What a beautiful garden they made!
He thinks of everything in terms of money.
They are agog to know what happened.
ko: 무슨 일이 있었는지 궁금해서 안달 났어.

en: They really wanted to know what happened.
ko: 무슨 일이 있었는지 정말 알고 싶어 했어.

en: They wondered what to do first.
They carried out a new experiment in chemistry.
They live on the floor beneath.
They were not listening to music.
They are talking about music.
They were dancing to the music.
They are sitting as if charmed by the music.
They grow strawberries in their greenhouse.
They should be pardoned by the amnesty law.
They are keen on outdoor sports.
They defied the laws of the king.
They bestowed several gifts on the royal visitors.
ko: 왕실 방문객들에게 선물을 여러 개 줬어.

en: They were ranged against the king.
They are plotting to kill the king.
They kept it to themselves that the king was dead.
ko: 왕이 죽었다는 걸 자기들끼리만 알고 비밀로 했어.

en: They demanded the king be put to death at once.
They walked two abreast.
They stand in need of help.
They formed themselves into a circle.
They offered assistance.
They set up a pole at the center of the circle.
They drove to the station by car.
They went to the station by car.
They hurried to the station.
Do they learn English?
Are they speaking English?
They are equally matched in their knowledge of English.
They could make themselves understood in English.
They like English.
They speak English or French or both.
ko: 걔네 영어 아니면 프랑스어, 아니면 둘 다 해.

en: They know how to swim.
They didn't swim because it was cold.
They were swimming.
They dropped in at our house on their way from the movie.
ko: 걔네 영화 보고 오는 길에 우리 집에 들렀어.

en: They laugh at him behind his back.
They found it exciting to play baseball on the playground.
ko: 걔네 운동장에서 야구 하는 거 되게 재밌어했어.

en: It seemed that they were telling a lie.
They sought shelter from the rain.
They made little of the pouring rain.
ko: 걔네 쏟아지는 비를 별거 아니라고 생각했어.

en: They got thoroughly wet in the rain.
They waited on the porch until it stopped raining.
ko: 걔네 비 그칠 때까지 현관에서 기다렸어.

en: They were pioneers of space flight.
They were given over to drinking.
They gave a series of concerts.
They were standing in a row.
They fell in love with each other at first sight.
They left early to catch the first train.
They are typical young people.
They had to work all year round.
ko: 걔네 일 년 내내 일해야 했어.

en: They had to stay at home all day.
ko: 걔네 하루 종일 집에 있어야 했어.

en: They stood up simultaneously.
They started all at once.
They're not afraid of hard work.
ko: 걔네 힘든 일 하는 거 안 두려워해.

en: They work hard.
They all answered "Yes" to a man.
They went there together.
They arrived in England a week ago.
They finished the work after a week.
ko: 걔네 일주일 뒤에 그 일 끝냈어.

en: They stayed at the hotel for a week.
They left the town an hour ago.
ko: 걔네 한 시간 전에 그 동네 떠났어.

en: They lost heart because they had won no games.
ko: 걔네 한 판도 못 이겨서 낙담했어.

en: They wear very little clothing.
ko: 걔네 옷을 거의 안 걸치고 다녀.

en: They sent for the doctor.
They exulted in their unexpected success.
ko: 걔네 예상치 못한 성공에 엄청 기뻐했어.

en: They sent me a sample in answer to my request.
They used to live next door to us.
They used to get on well together but now they are always quarreling.
ko: 걔네 전에는 잘 지냈는데 지금은 맨날 싸워.

en: They paid no attention to their safety.
ko: 걔네 안전에 전혀 신경 안 썼어.

en: They were attacking against overwhelming odds.
They rose against oppression.
They went by without saying 'hello'.
ko: 걔네 인사도 안 하고 그냥 지나갔어.

en: They talked about love.
They don't love their school enough.
They fell in love, and in due course they were married.
ko: 둘이 사랑에 빠져서 자연스럽게 결혼까지 했어.
